item.title: Don’t forget who fears the AI economy most
item.description: Artificial intelligence doomer narratives reflect personal fears, not economic reality.

item.title: Germany’s chancellor sets the standard for negotiating with China
item.description: As Friedrich Merz flies to D.C., it’s in America’s interest to shore up trading ties with the world’s third-biggest economy.

item.title: Trump’s Iran operation is the opposite of a ‘one and done’
item.description: Khamenei may be dead — but war with Iran isn’t over.

item.title: Thanks to President Trump, the hour of Iran’s freedom is at hand
item.description: Our path forward is a new constitution followed by free elections under international oversight.

item.title: Trump’s Iran gamble
item.description: It’s too early to call the riskiest foreign policy decision of this term a failure or success.

item.title: The FDA shifts the goalposts on rare disease drugs
item.description: Agency leaders say the right things, but their actions tell a different story.

item.title: There is no reason to think this war with Iran is necessary
item.description: Trump criticized the Iraq War. Now he’s making the same mistakes.

item.title: The rotten case for war with Iran
item.description: The Middle East is not as crucial as it was and the U.S. military is stretched thin.

item.title: A win for 11.9 million workers
item.description: Most independent contractors want the flexibility they lose when they become direct employees.

item.title: The Warner Bros. deal shows the market working

item.title: IRS lawbreaking insults all taxpayers
item.description: Sharing data with the Department of Homeland Security has implications for American citizens.

item.title: Wall Street’s AI panic is real. The predictions probably won’t be.
item.description: The warnings are coming from inside the industry, but that doesn’t make them right.

item.title: The fundamental problem with data center alarmism
item.description: It’s becoming fashionable for pandering politicians to call for “moratoriums” on new construction.

item.title: Gen Z instinctively understands something that everyone else misses

item.title: Trump isn’t delusional. He’s something far worse.
item.description: Revisiting the 2020 election and resetting our relationships with smartphones, in readers’ eyes.
